common.will_reboot:
The system will reboot now!
Please wait a bit until the process is finished.
common.will_shutdown:
Device shutdown!
You can turn the unit off from the power line when the ERROR LED is on. If you do not disconnect the unit within 5 minutes - the system will reboot and return to normal operation.
common.v_not_empty: The field must not be empty
common.v_min: The field must be a number greater than or equal to {{value}}.
common.v_max: The field must be a number less than or equal to {{value}}.
common.v_contain: The field must contain the value {{value}}.
common.v_eng_char_num: The field must contain only Latin letters and/or numbers
common.v_min_length: Field may not contain less than {{value}} characters
common.v_access_key: The field must contain the characters A-F, a-f, 0-9. The use of delimiters 'space', ':', '-', '.'
common.v_range_date: Please fix date and time so that the start date should precede the end date!
common.v_not_same: The field value must not match the field value {{field}}
common.v_hex: The field value must be in hexadecimal format
common.title_no_elements: Currently there are no data to display
common.access_error: The user account you are using does not have enough permissions for this action "{{ action_name }}"

wizard.user_notify: User "guest" is not safe and this account will be deleted, because anyone can use it. This step will create a new user with highest access rights (all rights for view/write). Keep your new username and password secure.

Monitoring settings are not saved after a reboot. Even if You press "Apply" or "Save settings" in each configuration window. To save after reboot, you need to press , to save current settings to flash memory.

Are you sure you want to save current settings?

systree.macros:
%1 - logic definition
%2 - state of sensors
%3 - date and time
%4 - logic name
%5{id} - sensor name (by identifier or %8)
%6{id} - sensor state (by identifier or %8)
%7{id} - sensor value (by identifier or %8)
%8 - last modified sensor id
%9{id} - units of measurement
%A{id} - sensor value without quotes (by identifier or %8)

tooltip.read_accesskeys: Management of iButton access keys and RFID cards: full access for reading include download log data
tooltip.read_cameras: Control of video cameras: view camera stream, elements are read on a general permissions
tooltip.read_canbus: CAN bus control: read CAN bus configuration
tooltip.read_devvirt: Virtual elements management (timer, ping, trigger, Modbus, math, dewpoint, SNMP get): read Modbus configuration, elements are read on a general permissions
tooltip.read_elements: General element management: reading of elements is always available
tooltip.read_groups: Group management: reading of groups is always available
tooltip.read_gsm: GSM modem control: get modem configuration and status
tooltip.read_log: System log management: view log messages
tooltip.read_modules: General modules management: reading of modules is always available
tooltip.read_notify: Notification management (mail, trap, sms, dial, web messages, push): notification elements are read on a general permissions
tooltip.read_sdcard: SD card, USB flash and SATA HDD management: read media configuration and status
tooltip.read_system: Runtime management, system control: view network, SNMP, GPS settings and time configuration
tooltip.read_users: User account management: read user list (no passwords)
tooltip.read_view: Map management: view map, elements are accessed on a general permissions
tooltip.read_all: Admin rights: full access for reading include download log data
tooltip.write_accesskeys: Management of iButton access keys and RFID cards: add new keys, delete keys, upload keys database
tooltip.write_cameras: Control of video cameras: add new IP cameras, delete IP cameras, elements are written on a general permissions
tooltip.write_canbus: CAN bus control: delete CAN devices, run and save CAN bus configuration
tooltip.write_devvirt: Virtual elements management (timer, ping, trigger, Modbus, math, dewpoint, SNMP get): add and delete virtual elements, set Modbus configuration, elements are written on a general permissions
tooltip.write_elements: General element management: modify elements, reset element charts data, save to flash
tooltip.write_groups: Group management: add and delete groups, disable group notifications
tooltip.write_gsm: GSM modem control: send SMS (forced by user), set modem configuration, send USSD request, clear SMS list
tooltip.write_log: System log management: manage FTP, e-mail and sensors dump configuration, clear log messages
tooltip.write_logics: Logic control: add new, delete, disable, turn on and off the logics schemes
tooltip.write_modules: General modules management: set up modules properties (not used now)
tooltip.write_notify: Notification management (mail, trap, sms, dial, web messages, push): add new, modify, delete and test sending notifications
tooltip.write_sdcard: SD card, USB flash and SATA HDD management: set media configuration
tooltip.write_system: Runtime management, system control: reboot unit, restore settings, upload certificates, set network, DynDNS, SNMP, GPS settings and time configuration
tooltip.write_users: User account management: add new, modify and delete user account
tooltip.write_view: Map management: upload map picture, configure map view, add sensors to map
tooltip.write_all: Admin rights: full admin access include upload new firmware, download system settings, setup Radius, backup and upgrade settings, analog sensors power, setup LTE and VPN connection

time.UTC-08:00: Pacific Standard Time, California, Nevada, Oregon, British Columbia
time.UTC-07:00: Mountain Standard Time, Arizona, Colorado, Alberta, Chihuahua, La Paz, Mazatlan

time.UTC-03:00: Argentina, Uruguay, Brasilia, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Greenland
time.UTC-02:00: Fernando de Noronha, South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands
time.UTC±00:00: Western European Time, United Kingdom, Ireland, Portugal, Madeira
time.UTC+01:00: Central European Time, Germany, France, Italy, Norway
time.UTC+02:00: Eastern European Time, Central Africa Time, Kaliningrad, Bulgaria, Greece, Cyprus, Finland
time.UTC+03:00: Moscow Time, St. Petersburg, Rostov-on-Don, Belarus, Ukraine, Kenya, Sudan
time.UTC+05:00: Western Asia Time, Yekaterinburg, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Pakistan
time.UTC+06:00: Omsk, Novosibirsk, Altai Krai, Astana, Almaty, Kyrgyzstan, Bhutan, Bangladesh
time.UTC+08:00: Beijing Time, Irkutsk, Hong Kong, Singapore, Ulan Bator, Kuala Lumpur
time.UTC+09:00: Japan, South Korea, North Korea, Yakutsk, Chita
time.UTC+09:30: Australian Central Standard Time, Adelaide, Darwin
time.UTC+10:00: Australian Eastern Standard Time, Vladivostok, Khabarovsk, Sakhalin, Magadan, Guam, Papua New Guinea
time.UTC+12:00: New Zealand, Kamchatka, Chukotka, Marshall Islands, Nauru

firmware.info_message: Select a file with the firmware or a file with previously saved system settings and upload it to update the system. Do not restart the unit manually and do not turn off the power, give the system time to update, after which the reboot will happen automatically and the changes will take effect.
firmware.header_select: Select the firmware file or saved settings file to restore
firmware.alert_1: Please specify correctly the local file to upload!
firmware.alert_5: Please specify path to file correctly!
firmware.alert_7: You do not have enough rights to complete the transaction!
firmware.confirm_1: Are you sure you want to upload new firmware?
firmware.success_upload:
The firmware was successfully uploaded!
Please wait a bit while the system reboots.
